text: Go over everything with the group

title: Mission Description
content: The truth of the planet is almost clear: The great calamity that ravaged the planet originated from theStellaron.The pastGuardianshave known about this but could do nothing about it. In the end, they chose to lie so that the city and its people could continue to live on the brink of desperation in this fabricated momentary peace.But this does not solve the problem. You are well aware that only by destroying the Stellaron can this planet andBelobogreturn to their correct path, and enable the Express to embark on its journey.Share your thoughts with your companions and decide on your next moves.

text: (ApproachGoethe Grand Hotel)

speaker: March 7th
line: Ahhhh... Well, now that we're done with that whole situation in the Underworld , we can finally look for the Stellaron.

speaker: March 7th
line: *sigh* But thinking about it, I feel a bit bad about Clara ... We promised her that our talks with Svarog would go peacefully...

text: Svarog attacked first.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ▶ (Trailblazer), you tried your best to persuade him. It's my fault for not preparing better for such a situation in advance.

text: Sorry, I wasn't able to persuade Svarog...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: You tried your best, don't blame yourself. I should've considered such a situation in advance. And it was Svarog who attacked first, we didn't have any other choice.

text: I forgot to be more diplomatic.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That certainly isn't our area of strength.

speaker: March 7th
line: I didn't mean for you guys to start beating yourselves up over it!

speaker: March 7th
line: Look on the bright side — things turned out alright, didn't they? Now everyone knows that the real problem here is the Stellaron, and they're willing to help us out.

speaker: March 7th
line: All in all, the mission is going super smoothly!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But we still have a lot left to figure out. For instance...

text: ...Where's the Stellaron?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Exactly. We don't even have the Stellaron's coordinates and location.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Cocolia 's sudden change in attitude is also very curious.

text: ...Why does Cocolia have it in for us?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Exactly. There must be a reason for this sudden change in her attitude.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: And, we still don't have the coordinates and location of the Stellaron.

text: ...Who is this Sampo character!?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...That's not of foremost concern.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: What's important is that we still don't have the exact location and coordinates of the Stellaron. Nor have we figured out the reason behind Cocolia's sudden change in attitude.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We still haven't put all of the pieces together...

text: Actually, I've been having some dreams...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Dreams?

speaker: March 7th
line: Oh, I remember you mentioned something about strange dreams before...

text: Telling Dan Heng and March 7th about the voices you heard in your recent dreams...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...All three dreams were the same, with Cocolia and that other voice...

speaker: March 7th
line: It would be weird to call it a coincidence.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I'm wondering if these dreams aren't just random, if there is some meaning behind them... Maybe you're having them because...

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Because of... the Stellaron inside ( him / her ) ?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That's my hunch, but I have no proof.

speaker: March 7th
line: Well then that's as good as nothing for now... So, what should we do when we get back above ground? After all this talk, we're still back at square one...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We solve a puzzle one piece at a time. Let's get some rest. We'll talk to Wildfire tomorrow and get to the bottom of this.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Also, there's still one more key character we haven't talked to yet. Her connection to Cocolia may be the key to cracking this mystery.

text: Return to the Goethe Grand Hotel and rest

title: Step Description
content: After an exchange of ideas and opinions, you quickly come up with a conclusion: The most urgent matter at hand is to return to the hotel and get a good night's sleep. You'll find out what the Wildfire thinks later.It may not sound like the most heroic thing to do, but a soft and fluffy mattress after hard fights and toil is simply too much of a temptation.A short break goes a long way towards preparing for the journey ahead. This is true for every traveler, and you are no exception.

text: (Talk to Gertie)
We would like to have a rest.

speaker: Gertie
line: You're back! I've heard from Wildfire that you helped resolve that whole situation with Svarog. Amazing!

speaker: Gertie
line: It must have been exhausting. Please, have some food and get a good night's rest.

text: I suppose it would be good to get some sleep...
Actually, I still have a lot of energy.
Go to bed

title: Step Description
content: Having had a thorough discussion, you quickly conclude that the priority is to return to the hotel and get a good night's sleep. You will ask what Wildfire makes of this later.It may sound outlandish, but how can one say no to a soft mattress after a long journey and harsh battle?You toss all the complaints about your bed behind, thinking it must be the nicest thing this world has to offer.Nighty-night. May you no longer be troubled by nightmares.

text: (Rest in the bed)
A wave of tiredness comes over you... reminding you that you haven't rested in a long time. Even the most terrible dream won't wake you up this time.
(While the Trailblazer rests,SeeleandBronyaconverse privately at theorphanage)

speaker: Seele
line: Over there, see that? That used to be the worst street in Rivet Town... and it's also where I grew up.

speaker: Seele
line: My friends and I used to wander those streets thinking about where to find our next meal. That is, until Chief Oleg got me out and took me to the orphanage.

speaker: Seele
line: There I learned to read and write from Natasha . At the age of 10, I started to patrol the mines with Oleg, occasionally getting into fights with the local thugs...

speaker: Bronya
line: ...That sounds nice.

speaker: Seele
line: Nice? You being sarcastic with me?

speaker: Bronya
line: Oh! No, sorry. Life in the Underworld is difficult, I shouldn't be speaking about it so lightly.

speaker: Seele
line: *sigh* You're always so serious... It really gets on people's nerves sometimes, you know?

speaker: Bronya
line: Right... Uh, what I meant was... I kind of envy you, Seele.

speaker: Bronya
line: For as long as I can remember, my days have been an endless cycle of studying, etiquette lessons, and training.

speaker: Bronya
line: Every day all I hear is "Remember who you are, Bronya," "This is against the Architects ' Admonishments, Bronya," "Ladies shouldn't use such foul language, Bronya"...

speaker: Bronya
line: ...Some may envy this kind of life, but I have felt... trapped. When every choice and every goal has already been made for you... You probably can't imagine how that feels.

speaker: Seele
line: ...No, I can't... But more importantly, what kind of "foul language" were you using?

speaker: Bronya
line: In the name of the Architects, I shall stick this spear into your nostril!

speaker: Seele
line: Hahaha, that's it? That's nothing. Looks like I'll have to teach you some Underworld slang before you go back.

speaker: Bronya
line: No, no, that won't be necessary.

speaker: Seele
line: It'll be better than poking people's nostrils at least...

speaker: Seele
line: I never thought that I'd be here having a heart-to-heart with the future guardian. As a kid, I didn't meet many people who lived in the Overworld . I only heard stories from the grown-ups and figured you were all just a bunch of cold snobs.

speaker: Bronya
line: I've heard from some Silvermane veterans that before the orders were made to seal off the Underworld from the Overworld, there was no difference between the two places. Everybody ate the same food, chatted about the same topics, celebrated the same festivals...

speaker: Bronya
line: Even though times are different now, things like the joys and sorrows of life, the ties between people... These precious things must certainly still connect us all.

speaker: Bronya
line: If there is a way to bridge the gap between the two worlds, we can definitely go back to the time when you and I were not divided. When we could stand side by side against the Eternal Freeze and the Fragmentum .

speaker: Seele
line: I'm not like you. I don't have that many grand plans for the future. But... if that's the future you want, I'm willing to build this bridge with you.

speaker: Bronya
line: Thank you, Seele. Your trust is very important to me.

speaker: Seele
line: Speaking of which, what are you going to do next? What Svarog revealed must've made quite an impact, huh...

speaker: Bronya
line: ...Yes. I thought I was prepared for anything, but...

speaker: Bronya
line: As long as I am the guardian's successor, those truths will come out sooner or later. But why does my mother hide it from me, and why does she want me to hunt down the outsiders who know about the nature of the Stellaron... It just... it doesn't make sense.

speaker: Bronya
line: I've thought it over. There's only one thing I can do — go ask her directly.

speaker: Seele
line: You... Hold on, you're not really going, are you? Alone? You can't, this plan is...

speaker: Bronya
line: I've already thought it through, Seele. I am Madam Cocolia's daughter. That will never change.

speaker: Bronya
line: Be it my duties as her heir, or a Silvermane Guard , I must face my problems head-on. Even if...

speaker: Seele
line: Bronya...

speaker: Bronya
line: This is for you, Seele. Please help me pass it on to the outsiders. If... If I'm unable to see you again... They'll know what to do.

speaker: Seele
line: ...Okay, I understand. You've made up your mind, and there's nothing I can say that will change it. But remember this — if you run into trouble, I will come to save you, no matter what.

speaker: Bronya
line: Then I'll be waiting for you.

speaker: Bronya
line: So... did you come to this spot when you were a child?

speaker: Seele
line: Of course. I just didn't appreciate how nice it was at the time.

speaker: Seele
line: ...Very nice.

text: (The Trailblazer awakens)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Ahh, that was a good sleep.)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I should go meet up with March and Dan Heng.)

text: Meet with the group

title: Step Description
content: Finally, a good night's sleep. Or not — because you can't remember if you had a nightmare during the night.Wouldn't hurt to stay a while longer to appreciate this simple yet cozy little room of yours... After all, there's no way to tell when you will be able to come back.Go meet the group when you are ready.

text: (Exit the room and talk to March 7th)

speaker: March 7th
line: Took you long enough sleepy head. We've been waiting all day!

speaker: March 7th
line: I've noticed that our sleep routines don't match up. You either keep getting up in the middle of the night or snoozing away until the day is almost out. Unacceptable. You gotta work on your teamwork!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), did you have a dream again last night?

text: Not this time.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...So that's why you slept for so long.

text: I dreamed that Hook and Pom-Pom got into a squabble.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...Huh, that's weird. I bet the conductor won, right?

text: I can't remember.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Oh, that happens to me all the time. It feels like I had a dream, but I can't remember anything about it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Well then, let's go find Wildfire to discuss our next move and see if they have any new discoveries.

speaker: March 7th
line: Let's go! I can't wait to finally get back above ground!

text: Discuss future plans with Wildfire members

title: Step Description
content: The longer you stay in this giant space underground, the harder it is to differentiate between the cold rock ceiling and the sky.It's time to return to the surface... But you wouldn't be able to without any help — because if you could, you would've already done so, isn't that right?"Wherever there is hardship and a cry for help, there is Wildfire." That is what Natasha once said. Go and ask them for a favor for the last time.

text: (Approach Seele, Oleg, and Sampo)

speaker: Oleg
line: Oh! Look who's here!

speaker: Sampo
line: ▶ It's the bane of Svarog! The big hero of the Underworld — (Trailblazer)!

speaker: Sampo
line: And the other big heroes, Dan Heng and March 7th!

speaker: March 7th
line: Were those lines rehearsed?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Where's Natasha? Is she here?

speaker: Oleg
line: She has a bunch of other things to attend to, so I hope you don't mind talking to this old man instead. I speak on behalf of Natasha.

speaker: Oleg
line: By the way, sorry for keeping that whole thing about her being the actual leader of Wildfire a secret. Hahaha...

text: It doesn't matter anyway...

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: I'm glad you don't mind. Natasha is always cautious, but she has no ill intent, as you surely have noticed.

text: What ever happened to trust?

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Hahaha, my apologies. Natasha is always cautious, but she has no ill intent, as you must have noticed.

text: I'm not seeing the apology here!

children.speaker: Oleg
children.line: Oh, well. I might just be second in command, but I still have a lot of responsibility. I couldn't give Natasha up right when we first met, could I? I had no clue that you bunch would become big heroes of the Underworld.

speaker: Oleg
line: She told me to make sure you return to the Overworld safely. I gave it some thought, and I think the safest way is to ask this fella for help.

speaker: Sampo
line: I brought you down. I can take you back up! Free of charge, satisfaction guaranteed.

speaker: March 7th
line: ...There's no need to knock us out this time, right?

speaker: Sampo
line: Of course not! This time we'll go back through the Furnace Core .

text: And why do we need you?

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Well, for my sparkling companionship of course! ...I jest, I jest! The path has been blocked for over ten years, and very few know how to get through. That's where I come in.

text: Just tell us the path you used before!

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: That would be... problematic, and dangerous. Trust me, we should go through the Furnace Core.

text: Oleg, give us someone else!

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Please, don't be like that. We have so much history together, can't you have a little faith?

speaker: Seele
line: Enough chatter. Just be a good guide!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Hold on. What about Bronya?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Why isn't she here?

speaker: Seele
line: She already went back. As you know, she has some things to settle with the Supreme Guardian.

speaker: March 7th
line: What? She just ditched us and went back? How could you let her...

text: She's not going to help us?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: It's not like that! She... just has many responsibilities to bear. I don't completely understand, I trust that she's trying to solve the problem.

text: She also has her own plan.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Exactly, she has a lot of responsibilities. I don't completely understand, but I trust that she's trying to solve the problem.

text: She left without Sampo?

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Enough about Sampo! We need him for this trip, and we can still get rid of him after we reach the surface.

children.speaker: Sampo
children.line: Miss Seele, I'm still here, you know...

speaker: Seele
line: Oh right, Bronya told me to give you this.

speaker: March 7th
line: She left us a letter. Hmm... could this be one of those "open-in-case-of-emergency" letters? I've never gotten one of those before. Should we wait until we run into something dangerous?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Stop overthinking and just open it.

text: (Quick Read)

children.text: (Trailblazer), March, Dan Heng: By the time you read this letter, I should have returned to the Overworld and be on my way to see my mother. I apologize for not telling you of my plan. I was afraid that you would strongly object, which might sway my resolve. Madam Cocolia raised me up, and I will never be able to repay her kindness. She taught me countless life lessons and virtues, as well as how to defend Belobog and its people. Even though she has lately made certain decisions that puzzled me, I can't let go of all the precious memories I have with her. I must communicate my point of view and thoughts to her honestly, and seek to arrive at a mutual understanding with her — this is my goal as a daughter, but also my duty as a Silvermane Guard. But I'm aware of the risks I might face on this journey. So, if I fail to win my mother's approval—or if something happens to me—please forward this letter to the Landau siblings and ask for their help. Serval and Gepard are honorable people with enormous power in Belobog, and I have complete faith in them. I'm sure they will unreservedly help you in your search for the Stellaron once they see my seal and handwriting. Bronya Rand

speaker: March 7th
line: Brother and sister Landau...? I know the brother must refer to Gepard, but who could the sister be...

speaker: March 7th
line: Oh, Serval! So she's Gepard's older sister!

text: How very astute of you.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Blonde, tall, good-looking... *sigh* Those Landau genes sure are something else.

text: I hope nothing happens to Bronya.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: She gave it some good thought, but whatever's going on in that supreme guardian's head... Even Bronya might have trouble understanding.

text: Maybe the "sister" refers to Gepard.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hey, stay on track!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Sampo, do you know the Landau siblings?

speaker: Sampo
line: Landau... Uhh yeah, we're old friends. I've mostly dealt with the younger brother in the past, but the sister... *shudder* She's much scarier. Today's supposed to be a day of celebration, so let's not talk about it right now.

speaker: Sampo
line: We can set out at any time. Just come find me when you're ready~
